messages.message: This is part of the larger schematic to new pricing models

We are selling windows and Office as one package but we should be selling windows…. and office is an addon. (Granted Windows gives a lot of things outside of the box like Internet Explorer, File Systems, Calculator, etc, etc)..
Step one is defining our app strategy so customers don’t go where did LENZ or VIZ go?!?!!
or my contract told me Visual refiner but its now Refiner V5!!?
Can we actually commit to removing these apps (Lens and Viz), in that case?
… I mean first commit to a deprecated category
We have this… which doesn’t even mirror the app page as well:
Which needs to be fixed but lets figure out if those 3 categories will work
so I can make contracts more advantageous for Instabase
I would expect a feature flag of some kind
I need to get rid of the Apps page, it should all just be in launcher

yes @Ashish we put apps that barely work or may not work in deprecated so we can get rid of them. During contract negotiations when they screenshot our apps and say I wan Lens… we say okay…. then the Account managment team gets absolutely destroyed because Lens isn’t useful so they’ll  make 100 feature requests, and then we have to tell them “hahah just kidding we put that app on there to make it seem like we had a lot of app’s”
and then the post sales teams get ruined because we thought we were clever with adding a lot of barely functioning apps
